list-item.p: In general, there are no gross-anatomical changes.
Rarely, some small areas of necrosis are seen lining the ventricles, i.e., necrotizing ependymitis.
Microglial nodules are seen scattered throughout the nervous system.
Large cells containing inclusion bodies are found within the microglial nodules.
The microglial nodules located in the gray and white matter are usually not surrounded by a necrotic area.
Along the periventricular spaces CMV-containing cells are found within the necrotic areas.
